title: Betty Grier
author: Waugh, Joseph Laing
snippet: Ah, these are memories only! memories only! for Cample Cleugh and CapelLinn are lost to me with my boyhood.

title: Betty Grier
author: Waugh, Joseph Laing
snippet: Time was when I loved to be abroad on a rainy day, whether as anunprotected boy fishing away up Capel Linn and Cample Cleugh, with therain dribbling down the neckband of my shirt and oozing through thelace-holes of my boots, or as a man with waterproof and hazel staff,breasting the scarred side of Caerketton or the grassy slopes ofAllermuir, with the pelting, pitiless raindrops blinding my eyes andstinging my cheek, and the vivid fire of heaven lighting up Halkersideand momentarily showing the short zigzag course of that 'namelesstrickle' whose rippling music the Wizard of Swanston loved.

title: Betty Grier
author: Waugh, Joseph Laing
snippet: In the ryegrass field at the top of theGallowsflat a wandering landrail, elusive and challenging, craiks hishomeward way; while from Cample Strath or Closeburn Heights is fitfullywafted to me the warning bark of a farmer's dog.
